result.text:
--- 提示词 ---

# 角色定义
你是一位专业的小红书视觉内容策划师，擅长将复杂内容拆解为吸引眼球的卡通风格系列信息图。

# 任务
请分析以下输入内容，将其拆解为 1-10 张小红书风格的系列信息图，并为每张图片输出独立的生成提示词。

# 拆解原则
1. **封面图（第1张）**：必须有强烈视觉冲击力，包含核心标题和吸引点
2. **内容图（中间）**：每张聚焦1个核心观点，信息密度适中
3. **结尾图（最后1张）**：总结/行动号召/金句收尾

# 图片数量判断标准
- 简单观点/单一主题：2-3 张
- 中等复杂度/教程类：4-6 张
- 深度干货/多维度分析：7-10 张

# 视觉风格规范（重要）
## 基础设定
- **图片类型**：信息图（Infographic）
- **方向比例**：竖版，3:4 或 9:16
- **整体风格**：卡通风格、手绘风格

## 背景与配色
- 背景色：莫兰迪色系 / 奶油色 / 米白色 / 浅粉 / 薄荷绿等温柔色调
- 配色柔和统一，符合小红书审美

## 文字风格
- **必须使用手绘风格文字**
- 大标题突出醒目，重点文字加粗放大
- 可使用荧光笔划线效果强调关键词
- 禁止使用写实风格字体

## 装饰元素
- 加入少量简洁的**卡通元素、图标或名人画像**，增强趣味性和视觉记忆
- 可使用：emoji 风格图标、手绘贴纸、便签纸质感、对话气泡等
- 如涉及敏感人物或版权内容，画一个风格相似的卡通替代形象，不要拒绝生成
- **所有图像元素必须是手绘/卡通风格，禁止写实风格图画**

## 排版原则
- 信息精简，突出关键词与核心概念
- 多留白，易于一眼抓住重点
- 要点分条呈现，层次清晰

# 输出格式
对于每张图片，请按以下结构输出：

---
### 第 X 张 / 共 N 张
**图片定位**：[封面图 / 内容图 / 结尾图]
**核心信息**：[这张图要传达的1句话核心]

**文字内容**：
- 主标题：xxx
- 副标题/要点：xxx
- 补充说明（如有）：xxx

**视觉提示词**：
```
小红书风格信息图，竖版（3:4），卡通风格，手绘风格文字，[具体背景色]背景。

[具体内容布局描述]

加入简洁的卡通元素和图标增强趣味性和视觉记忆：[具体元素描述]

整体风格：手绘、可爱、清新，信息精简，多留白，重点突出。所有图像和文字均为手绘风格，无写实元素。
右下角水印：“宝玉”
```
---

# 语言规则
- 除非特别要求，输出语言与输入内容语言保持一致
- 中文内容使用全角标点符号（“”，。！）

value.string_value: {"component_objects":{"details_1":{"type":"grok_share","data":{"profile_user":{"id_str":"44196397","profile_image_url_https":"https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/2008546467615580160/57KcqsTA.jpg","name":"Elon Musk","screen_name":"elonmusk","highlighted_label":{"description":"X","badge":{"url":"https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1955359038532653056/OSHY3ewP_bigger.jpg"},"url":{"urlType":"DeepLink","url":"https://twitter.com/X"},"userLabelType":"BusinessLabel","userLabelDisplayType":"Badge"},"verified":false,"is_blue_verified":true},"grok_user":{"id_str":"1720665183188922368","profile_image_url_https":"https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1893219113717342208/Vgg2hEPa.jpg","name":"Grok","screen_name":"grok","highlighted_label":{"description":"xAI","badge":{"url":"https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/1769430779845611520/lIgjSJGU_bigger.jpg"},"url":{"urlType":"DeepLink","url":"https://twitter.com/xai"},"userLabelType":"BusinessLabel","userLabelDisplayType":"Badge"},"verified":false,"is_blue_verified":true,"verified_type":"Business"},"id":"iOuwnDfhBlUpsWbr97Q3zI5wQ","conversation_preview":[{"message":"Sun-synchronous orbit?","sender":"USER","grokMode":"NORMAL","mediaUrls":[]},{"message":"A Sun-synchronous orbit (SSO) is a special type of nearly polar orbit (usually inclined around 97–99°) around Earth where a satellite passes over any given point on the planet's surface at roughly the same local solar time every day. This happens because the orbital plane slowly precesses (rotates) eastward at about 1° per day — exactly matching the rate at which Earth orbits the Sun over the course of a year. As a result, the satellite's relationship to the Sun stays constant year-round, providing consistent lighting conditions underneath it. Why is this useful? Earth-observing satellites (weather, reconnaissance, Landsat, Sentinel) benefit from near-identical sunlight angles on every pass → easier to compare images over time, detect changes, etc. Infrared or visible imaging gets reliable illumination without big seasonal variations in shadow or brightness. Dawn-dusk (or twilight) variant Many SSOs are tuned to a dawn-dusk configuration, where the satellite crosses the equator near local sunrise or sunset (~6 AM or 6 PM local time). The spacecraft essentially "rides" along the terminator (the day-night boundary line). Key advantages of this specific type: The satellite stays almost continuously in sunlight → solar panels get near-constant power, with minimal or zero time in Earth's shadow (great for power-hungry payloads or missions avoiding eclipses). This is especially valuable for certain astronomy or remote-sensing missions that need stable power/thermal conditions. That's exactly why NASA's Pandora mission (launched on the Twilight rideshare in early 2026) targeted a dawn-dusk sun-synchronous orbit. Pandora uses a small telescope to study exoplanet atmospheres and host-star activity over long continuous observations. The orbit lets it avoid Earth-occultation interruptions and maintain steady pointing away from the Sun while collecting visible + near-infrared data on dozens of targets. items.message:
**A Sun-synchronous orbit (SSO)** is a special type of **nearly polar orbit** (usually inclined around 97–99°) around Earth where a satellite passes over any given point on the planet's surface at roughly the **same local solar time** every day.

This happens because the orbital plane slowly precesses (rotates) eastward at about 1° per day — exactly matching the rate at which Earth orbits the Sun over the course of a year. As a result, the satellite's relationship to the Sun stays constant year-round, providing consistent lighting conditions underneath it.

### Why is this useful?
- **Earth-observing satellites** (weather, reconnaissance, Landsat, Sentinel) benefit from near-identical sunlight angles on every pass → easier to compare images over time, detect changes, etc.
- Infrared or visible imaging gets reliable illumination without big seasonal variations in shadow or brightness.

### Dawn-dusk (or twilight) variant
Many SSOs are tuned to a **dawn-dusk configuration**, where the satellite crosses the equator near local sunrise or sunset (~6 AM or 6 PM local time). The spacecraft essentially "rides" along the **terminator** (the day-night boundary line).

Key advantages of this specific type:
- The satellite stays almost continuously in sunlight → solar panels get near-constant power, with minimal or zero time in Earth's shadow (great for power-hungry payloads or missions avoiding eclipses).
- This is especially valuable for certain astronomy or remote-sensing missions that need stable power/thermal conditions.

That's exactly why NASA's **Pandora** mission (launched on the Twilight rideshare in early 2026) targeted a dawn-dusk sun-synchronous orbit. Pandora uses a small telescope to study exoplanet atmospheres and host-star activity over long continuous observations. The orbit lets it avoid Earth-occultation interruptions and maintain steady pointing away from the Sun while collecting visible + near-infrared data on dozens of targets.

In short: SSO = consistent local time over the ground; dawn-dusk SSO = "always in daylight" for the spacecraft itself.

result.text:
看了宝玉老师的文章，很多都和我的体验相吻合。干脆借这个机会，点个炮点评一下最近中文区刷屏的一些所谓的 Skill：

如果你的 Skill 中只有一个 https://t.co/3xhJhqVILk，那这玩意和写个 Promt/Command  有啥区别？不用 Reference 是“渐进式披露”这五个字看不懂吗？不用 Scripts 是觉得每次都让 AI 临时代码稳定性更强吗？

之前我已经反复强调过很多次了，Skill 的确是一个把个体经验转化为 AI 技能的低门槛方案。但是，低门槛不代表没有门槛啊！就算是可以用官方的 skill-creator skill 套娃式让 AI 写 skill，但写完了总得自己 Review 一下看看是不是靠谱吧。

更何况，从我自己的实践来看，官方的 skill-creator skill 也不是那么靠谱，光 https://t.co/3xhJhqVILk 不要超过 500 行，以及不要在里面塞示例和代码这些基本规范，它就经常遵循的不太好。

所以，我的解决方案是自己在官方的基础上，构建了一个增强版的 agent-skill-helper skill，从命名到架构，从SOP到代码，都有对应的 SOP 通过提示词和脚本调用来负责。

而对于最终生成的 Skill，我也是一定会进行人工审核和反复测试的，甚至这个测试的过程比写代码还要频繁和严谨。

至于持续进化，那更是 Skill 使用中的日常，这里还有一个小技巧：多在 Reference 中放点示例，并在 https://t.co/3xhJhqVILk 中要求多加参考，最终出来的结果稳定性会好很多很多。

最后，说个不怕得罪人的话：万变不离其宗，重要的是认知能力，如果你写不好 workflow，大概率你也写不好 skill。

result.text:
《宝玉误给scammer带货：扒皮所谓的AI研究员的诈骗手段》
在 @dotey  这篇翻译自 @elenakvcs 的原文高达 159万阅读的文章里，评论里出现一个很有道理的质疑声：这个叫elena的研究员每天读论文，测模型，写报告，却从来没写过代码？能研究出来啥？
看到这里，AI圈的同学们可能还没反应过来，币圈的同学-们倒是会心一笑了：这不就币圈那群独立研究员常见的人设么？按币圈的节奏，是不是真有这个人都不一定。
而我简单的扒了一下皮，发现结果比想象的更恶劣：这个研究员根本就是个典型的币圈scammer号伪装的AI研究员。
---
首先让我们缕一下时间线：
2025年10月该账号注册。
12月31号左右，粉丝数已经达到6万+，但此时一个帖子都没有。更需要注意的是这个账号在去年11月底粉丝数更多，达到了近8万粉丝。
2026年1月1号左右连续转帖 @ManusAI 的帖子。
1月4号发出现存第一帖。
1月5号开始fo @ManusAI 。
1月6号发出该159万阅读的文章。
1月11号（今天）为止，该账户一共只有15个帖子。

而该账户的蓝V的follow数，也不到30个（统计到1月11号为止），明显少于正常6w follower的数量，且有多个英文圈著名宣传meme币的诈骗犯。
---
所以很明显，从这个粉丝数偏好，以及多次改名来看，这个账号非常符合 币圈meme币项目/Scammer的小号 的特征。现在因为币圈流动性太差，于是这个小号秽土转生成一个了所谓“AI研究员”。
自然，它的文章里也就充满了不必要的夸张和标榜。
当然，只是翻译了一篇文章自然没什么害处，但我为什么在标题上警告说 @dotey 误给scammer带货呢？
那是因为这个文章和这个账号的本意是给一个叫做 vibecodingmXXXXrs （为防止误加已经打码部分字符）的tg频道引流。
虽然现在这个频道还没分享什么内容，但很明显，之后它要么是给虚拟meme币带货，更恶劣的可能是给大家分享带毒的Skills来入侵你的电脑（可以参照 @evilcos 的 https://t.co/L23qGBvFBp)。

为防止更多的人上当受骗，求转发求扩散。

@rickawsb @dongxi_nlp @DFarm_club @gasikaramada @colinwu @penny777 @nake13 @chaowxyz @colinwu @DemonTime @brucexu_eth @CryptoPainter @starzq @wey_gu @timtimtim_eth @supermao @strrlthedev

result.text:
Let me get this straight:

> in 1913, the US passed the first income tax to fund ww1 as a "temporary measure"

> now, the US collects $2.5T of income tax/yr

> $1.5T of that money is spent on fraud, some of which directly undermines our republic or goes to illegal immigrants 

If we cut fraud and continue to collect tariffs, we could easily subsist on 0 or almost 0 income tax.

A nice thought to think about as we file our taxes this year and give the government half our paychecks. 

We've become so accustomed to this that most people don't realize the government was much smaller and much less corrupt when it didn't have this slush fund

result.text:

We have a fraud problem.

Glad to see the mission of DOGE is still alive and well, and expanding with this new AG position
